contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks as if he is in court and the mountains and hills are the judges. He commands the people of Israel to tell the judges why they have done what they did. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: Arise and state your case before the mountains; let the hills hear your voice

contextId.occurrenceNote: Micah is speaking to these things as if they are humans. Micah is using the mountains, hills, and foundations of the earth as an eternal witness against his people's idolatry. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: you mountains ... you enduring foundations of the earth
